intro: Agyneia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf agyneia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often aromatic and finely divided. It produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Agyneia lanceolata is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
